intro: Hieracium alexandri, commonly known as Alexandrian hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
